comment.text: This translation key is used for the title of a modal dialog that prompts the user to stop filling a form field. It appears on the header of the dialog and is displayed when the "Stop Filling" button is clicked or visible in certain contexts.

usage.context:
visible={visible}
 displayType={ModalDialogType.modal}
 onClose={onClose}
 data-testid="stop-filling-dialog"
 >
 <ModalDialog.Header>{t("Common:StopFillingTitle")}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>{t("Common:StopFillingBody")}</ModalDialog.Body>
 <ModalDialog.Footer>
 <Button
 id="stop-filling-dialog_submit"
 key="OKButton"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Doldurmaq dayandırılsın?' is a bit literal and doesn't sound natural in Azerbaijani. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'Dayandırılsın?' or 'Doldurma dayandırılsın?'
The German translation "Mit dem Ausfüllen stoppen?" is technically correct but sounds unnatural. A more natural phrasing would be "Ausfüllen beenden?" or "Beenden?" (if the context allows it).
The translation "Դադարե՞լ լրացնելը" is a literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Armenian. While grammatically correct, it sounds awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation would be something like "Կդադարես լրացնելը?" or simply "Դադարեմ լրացնելը?" or even a shorter "Ավարտեմ?" depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Interrompere la compilazione?' while grammatically correct, is a bit formal for a simple question like 'Stop filling?'. A more natural translation would be closer to a direct equivalent or a slightly more conversational option.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Smettere di compilare?' or 'Fermare la compilazione?'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "작성을 중지하시겠습니까?" is a very formal way of asking "Stop filling?". It's closer to "Would you like to stop writing?" A more natural and conversational translation would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more casual option like "작성 멈출까요?" or "작성 중지할까요?"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation "ຢຸດຕິມແລ້ວບໍ?" while understandable, is a bit literal and less natural. A more common and idiomatic phrasing for 'Stop filling?' would be something like "ຢຸດຕື່ມແລ້ວບໍ່?" or "ຢຸດຕື່ມແລບໍ່?"
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຢຸດຕື່ມແລ້ວບໍ່?

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation "Doriți să încetați completarea?" is a very literal and formal translation of "Stop filling?". It implies a formal request for confirmation. A more natural and user-friendly translation would be more conversational.
The use of "completarea" is grammatically correct, but it sounds overly technical for a simple "Stop filling?" prompt. It's a more formal word than necessary.

The translation "නොපිරීම නවත්තන්නද?" doesn't perfectly capture the nuance of "Stop filling?".  'නොපිරීම' refers to 'not filling' rather than the act of stopping filling. A more accurate translation would convey the meaning of halting the filling process.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "ගෙවීම නවත්වන්නද?" (payment stop?) or "බුරුසු නවත්තන්නද?" (stop the brush/filler?). The best alternative will depend on the exact context of the original English phrase.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Ustavi izpolnjevanje?' is a literal translation and doesn't quite capture the natural phrasing of "Stop filling?" in Slovenian. It sounds a bit formal and awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation would be 'Prenehaj z izpolnjevanjem?' or 'Ne želiš več izpolnjevati?' or simply 'Ustavi?' depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Зауставите попуњавање?' while literally translating to 'Stop filling?', doesn't quite capture the conversational nuance of 'Stop filling?' in this context. It sounds overly formal and direct. A more natural and idiomatic translation would be better.
The translation 'Doldurma durdurulsun mu?' is overly formal and doesn't accurately convey the simple, questioning tone of 'Stop filling?'. It implies a more complex process or request.
The translation uses passive voice ('doldurma durdurulsun'), which is less natural than active voice for a simple question.  The original English is direct.

The translation "Të ndahet plotësimi?" doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "Stop filling?". It translates more literally to 'To separate the filling?' which is not the intended meaning. The intended meaning is a question asking if someone wants to stop the filling process.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Mundësisht, 'Ndalo plotësimin?' or 'Të ndalohet plotësimi?' would be more accurate translations. A more conversational option could be 'Përplete plotësimin?'
